Dear user of blogger.com!

I am a spyware software developer.
Your account has been hacked by me in the summer of 2019.

The hacking was carried out using a hardware vulnerability through which you went online (Cisco router, vulnerability CVE-2019-12643).

I went around the security system in the router, installed an exploit there.
When you went online, my exploit downloaded my malicious code (rootkit) to your device.
This is driver software, I constantly updated it, so your antivirus is silent all time.

Since then I have been following you (I can connect to your device via the VNC protocol).
That is, I can see absolutely everything that you do, view and download your files and any data to yourself.
I also have access to the camera on your device, and I periodically take photos and videos with you.

At the moment, I have harvested a solid dirt... on you...
I saved all your email and chats from your messangers. I also saved the entire history of the sites you visit.

I note that it is useless to change the passwords. My malware update passwords from your accounts every times.

Oh my God, what are your like... I saw THIS ... Oh, you dirty naughty person ... :)

Believe it turned out very high quality!

So, to the business!

Transfer $927 to my Bitcoin cryptocurrency wallet: 1CDKLgab6xUnAwP5q5x3jdDy8978Bt2iCZ

As soon as the specified amount is received, all your data will be destroyed from my server, and the rootkit will be automatically removed from your system.

Líneas no bancarias
 

Hola,

Solo quiero recordarte que estamos operativos todo agosto y septiembre y que si necesitas financiación ahora es una buen momento para ponerte en contacto para que podamos empezar a trabajar cuanto antes.

Como ya sabes (si recibes esto es porque nos has pedido información en algún momento) Iberfinancia es la empresa de Intermediación Financiera para Pymes líder en España.

Somos especialistas en conseguir la fondos de todo tipo para empresas, así que si necesitas financiación:

Déjanos tus datos y te llamamos

Gracias,

Bárbara

post_text:
Iberfinancia
 

Hola,

Hoy te escribo para que veas la diferencia que supone tener los contactos correctos a la hora de negociar con bancos y otras entidades.

Hace unas semanas empezó a trabajar con nosotros una empresa que no era capaz de conseguir más financiación. Necesitaban 150.000 euros, pero ningún banco se los daba.

(Si prefieres que te lo cuente de palabra, haz clic aquí y te llamo.)

Después de estudiar su caso, presentamos la operación en varias entidades. Ente ellas una en la que el cliente ya lo había intentado sin conseguir ningún avance.

Gracias a nuestros contactos conseguimos hablar con el interlocutor correcto y esa misma entidad nos ofreció una operación de 150.000€ y otra más de igual importe, que aun estamos negociando. Tener buenos contactos es imprescindible.

¿Tienes planes y vas a necesitar inversión? Tú pones tu empresa y tu trabajo y nosotros nos encargamos del resto.

Sigue el siguiente enlace y te llamaré en cuanto pueda.

Haz clic aquí para que te llame.

Espero que hablemos pronto.

Un saludo,

Jorge

post_text:
Minetur

LÍNEAS DEL MINETUR

Estas son las líneas más interesantes para Pymes de las promovidas por el Minetur (Ministerio de Industria, Energía y Turismo).

¡Conócelas!

• Enisa Competitividad.

Entre 25mil y 1,5M de euros. Con vencimiento máximo a 9 años con un máximo de 7 de carencia del principal.

Para mejora o cambio de sistemas productivos y expansión.

• Enisa Agenda Digital.

Entre 25mil y 1,5M de euros. Con vencimiento máximo a 9 años con un máximo de 7 de carencia del principal.

Para emprendedores y pymes que impulsen proyectos del sector TIC.

• Enisa emprendedores.

Entre 25mil y 300mil euros. Con vencimiento máximo de 6 años con un máximo de 2 años de carencia del principal.

Para empresas de menos de 2 años de antigüedad.

• Enisa jóvenes emprendedores.

Entre 25mil y 75mil euros, con vencimiento máximo de 4 años con un año de carencia del principal.

Para empresas de menos de 2 años de antigüedad con socios mayoritarios menores de 40 años.

 

Somos expertos en gestionar estas líneas.

Podemos conseguir lo que necesitas.

Llámanos al 981 90 49 49

o

Déjanos tus datos y te llamamos nosotros

Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!
Preview The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners free for 21 days. You can return The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners at the end of the preview if you decide not to purchase it.

post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132

Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!

post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!

post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!
Preview The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners free for 21 days. You can return The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners at the end of the preview if you decide not to purchase it.

post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!

Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!

post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45

post_title: The Ultimate Guide to Cycling for Beginners
post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!
Preview The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners free for 21 days. You can return The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners at the end of the preview if you decide not to purchase it.

post_text:
Transform your body with The Body Fat Breakthrough — for your FREE 21-day trial, Click HERE!
At Women's Health, we want to help you rock your best body in record time! Finding the right plan to fit into your lifestyle is key to your success. Last year, Dr. Ellington Darden brought Women's Health a groundbreaking body transformation plan so incredible we couldn't resist turning it into the only weight loss book you'll ever need. We tested the plan out on 44 men and women, and seven lost 30 pounds in 30 days, four lost 50 pounds in 50 days, and one lost a whopping 80 pounds in 80 days! Pretty amazing, right? That's why we're so excited to share The Body Fat Breakthrough with you! If you're ready to obliterate belly fat fast, this is your plan. The best part? All it takes is as little as 30 minutes of exercise a week!
Can you really accomplish all that in just 30 days? Yes! The plan in The Body Fat Breakthrough can show you how!
Discover how Julie McGinley lost
22 pounds. See her story to the right!

Trim inches off your waist! You can have a brand-new body in just 30 days!

The Body Fat Breakthrough achieves record-breaking results — both for creating sculpted, lean muscle and dropping fat fast.

Find out more FREE for 21 days! Click HERE!
We know what you're thinking. You're skeptical and wonder how this is all possible. Don't be. Dr. Ellington Darden's program has a unique effect on muscle and fat balance. Through his “30-30-30 negative-accentuated program,” he emphasizes using superslow resistance exercises. That “deeper” stimulation of muscle fibers in turn prompts the release of five key hormones involved in sculpting fat-burning lean muscle. While your muscles are growing faster, the same hormones act to pull calories out of fat cells, which then shrink!

Eliminate tummy bulge

Reduce thigh thickness

Say bye-bye to the dreaded back-of-the-arm flab “bat wings”

Learn more about the physiological and nutritional reasons why this plan is so exceptional now — just Click HERE!
Success with The Body Fat Breakthrough does not require you to turn your life upside down. Through simple changes you can experience an amazing transformation.

Your workouts can be done with exercise machines, free weights, or just your own body weight.

Your workouts are brief — 30 minutes max, or even less. The first few weeks, you'll do two workouts; after that, just one a week!

Stimulate your metabolism enjoying delicious foods, even satisfying carbs like bread, cereal, pasta, or potatoes!

Prove to yourself what Dr. Darden has shown with over 100 test subjects! Try his plan FREE for 21 days — just Click HERE!
Get your free gift when you preview The Body Fat Breakthrough free for 21 days. You can return The Body Fat Breakthrough at the end of the preview if you decide not to purchase it.
The people portrayed in this promotion experienced extraordinary results using The Body Fat Breakthrough plan. Regular exercise and proper nutrition are essential to achieving and maintaining your desired physique. Even using the same program of diet and exercise, individual results will vary. Results not typical.

post_title: The Ultimate Guide to Cycling for Beginners
post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!
Preview The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners free for 21 days. You can return The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners at the end of the preview if you decide not to purchase it.

post_title: The Ultimate Guide to Cycling for Beginners
post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!
Preview The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners free for 21 days. You can return The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners at the end of the preview if you decide not to purchase it.

The Body Fat Breakthrough achieves record-breaking results — both for creating sculpted, lean muscle and dropping fat fast.

Find out more FREE for 21 days! Click HERE!
We know what you’re thinking. You’re skeptical and wonder how this is all possible. Don’t be. Dr. Ellington Darden’s program has a unique effect on muscle and fat balance. Through his “30-30-30 negative-accentuated program,” he emphasizes using superslow resistance exercises. That “deeper” stimulation of muscle fibers in turn prompts the release of five key hormones involved in sculpting fat-burning lean muscle. While your muscles are growing faster, the same hormones act to pull calories out of fat cells, which then shrink!

Eliminate tummy bulge

Reduce thigh thickness

Say bye-bye to the dreaded back-of-the-arm flab “bat wings”

Learn more about the physiological and nutritional reasons why this plan is so exceptional now — just Click HERE!
Success with The Body Fat Breakthrough does not require you to turn your life upside down. Through simple changes you can experience an amazing transformation.

Your workouts can be done with exercise machines, free weights, or just your own body weight.

Your workouts are brief — 30 minutes max, or even less. The first few weeks, you’ll do two workouts; after that, just one a week!

Stimulate your metabolism enjoying delicious foods, even satisfying carbs like bread, cereal, pasta, or potatoes!

Οι τελευταίες ειδήσεις 07.01.2015
  • 11:23 | Ελλάδα

    Θα ξαναχιονίσει στην Αττική το απόγευμα - Λευκές χειροπέδες σε Εύβοια, Κρήτη και Κυκλάδες

    - Νέα χιονόπτωση στην Αττική από τις 4.00 το απόγευμα, θα χιονίσει και στο κέντρο της Αθήνας
    - Σε παγοδρόμια έχουν μετατραπεί οι δρόμοι των βορείων προαστίων της Αττικής
    - Ο παγετός δυσκολεύει τη ζωή των πεζών που δίνουν μάχη για να περπατήσουν
    - Στο έλεος του χιονιά Κρήτη, Εύβοια και Κυκλάδες
    - Η κακοκαιρία θα υποχωρήσει σταδιακά μέσα στη νύχτα
    - Δείτε που χρειάζονται αλυσίδες και που είναι κλειστοί οι δρόμοι
    ΦΩΤΟ και VIDEO NEWSIT


    ...

    » Πλήρης είδηση
  • 11:17 | Πολιτική

    Ντόρα Μπακογιάννη στο newsit: Δεν μας άφησε το ΠΑΣΟΚ να κυβερνήσουμε!

    Ο χώρος που έγινε η συζήτηση με την Ντόρα Μπακογιάννη προσέδωσε ένα συμβολισμό τόσο στη συγκυρία όσο και στην ίδια τη συζήτηση.      Το βάρος στην Β΄Αθήνων ρίχνει το κομματικό επιτελείο της ΝΔ για το λόγο αυτό ο πρωθυπουργός και πρόεδρος της ΝΔ Αντώνης Σαμαράς πρόκειται τα επόμενα εικοσιτετράωρα να μιλήσει σε δύο μεγάλους δήμους της μεγαλύτερης εκλογικής περιφέρειας της χώρας....

post_title: The Ultimate Guide to Cycling for Beginners
post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!
Preview The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners free for 21 days. You can return The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners at the end of the preview if you decide not to purchase it.

We know what you’re thinking. You’re skeptical and wonder how this is all possible. Don’t be. Dr. Ellington Darden’s program has a unique effect on muscle and fat balance. Through his “30-30-30 negative-accentuated program,” he emphasizes using superslow resistance exercises. That “deeper” stimulation of muscle fibers in turn prompts the release of five key hormones involved in sculpting fat-burning lean muscle. While your muscles are growing faster, the same hormones act to pull calories out of fat cells, which then shrink!

Eliminate tummy bulge

Reduce thigh thickness

Say bye-bye to the dreaded back-of-the-arm flab “bat wings”

Your workouts can be done with exercise machines, free weights, or just your own body weight.

Your workouts are brief — 30 minutes max, or even less. The first few weeks, you’ll do two workouts; after that, just one a week!

Stimulate your metabolism enjoying delicious foods, even satisfying carbs like bread, cereal, pasta, or potatoes!

post_text:
EXCLUSIVE! Not available in stores! Click here
Dear Friend:

If you dream of harvesting huge basketfuls of veggies — free of problems that plague other gardeners — then I have a book with your name on it! But you don't have to buy it ... because you can have it free with your order!
Healthy Soil, Healthy Plants, Healthy Harvest is your one-stop answer book that'll give you predictably wonderful results season after season, year after year! Open up your FREE book and you'll see how to:

• Power up your garden soil! Discover the secrets of creating fast soil-enriching compost ... the potent compost tea recipe that helps turbocharge plant growth and prevent disease ... and clever mulching secrets to help solve your weeding woes forever.

• Prevent problems from cropping up! Discover the timing and planting secrets for garden success ... how to attract beneficial insects to thwart plant-ruining pests ... and much more.

• Stretch your garden season for MORE veggies! See how to jumpstart your garden by planting seeds inside ... protect early-season plants with simple cover-ups ... and prolong your growing season with smart cold-frame secrets.

• Grow the healthiest, tastiest veggies with these plant-by-plant secrets! For each of 20 common vegetable crops, you'll discover tips for planting, caring for, and harvesting at peak of flavor, plus ingenious secrets of success that help guarantee the best possible results!

Why am I going to send you this book for FREE?

Because I'd like to introduce you to ORGANIC GARDENING, the magazine that has been helping smart gardeners grow great crops without chemicals for almost 70 years!

Try ORGANIC GARDENING for 30 days and cancel if you decide not to continue.
From choosing the best flowers, shrubs, trees, fruits, and veggies to arranging them for spectacular effect, you'll see how to get great results without chemicals!

Plus, you'll get ingenious advice to safely control weeds and pests ... build super-fertile soil ... and grow and prepare a wide variety of vegetables at the peak of flavor.

Don't miss out on this exclusive double-FREE offer to enjoy a healthier, more beautiful garden with the best-tasting veggies you've ever eaten!

Happy Gardening!
Kelly Jennings
for ORGANIC GARDENING
Follow the simple growing secrets in your FREE book, and you'll enjoy the biggest, tastiest garden veggies you've ever grown! For example:
 
SWEETER LETTUCE: These smart tips will help lettuce cope with the heat. Page 44

BIGGER BROCCOLI: Heads can be 2 inches bigger when planted later! Page 32		  
   
  FASTER POTATOES: This simple preseason trick guarantees a quicker harvest! Page 55

FASTER-GROWING MELONS: When they get baseball size, set them on the "throne"! Page 46

PERFECT CORN: Add a few drops of this (see page 31) to prevent earworm damage.

EXCELLENT ONIONS: The secret to success is how you prepare for planting! Page 48		  
 
And that's just a small taste of all the practical help you'll get in your FREE BOOK!

post_title: The Ultimate Guide to Cycling for Beginners
post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!
Preview The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners free for 21 days. You can return The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners at the end of the preview if you decide not to purchase it.

post_text:
EXCLUSIVE! Not available in stores! Click here
Dear Friend:

If you dream of harvesting huge basketfuls of veggies — free of problems that plague other gardeners — then I have a book with your name on it! But you don't have to buy it ... because you can have it free with your order!
Healthy Soil, Healthy Plants, Healthy Harvest is your one-stop answer book that'll give you predictably wonderful results season after season, year after year! Open up your FREE book and you'll see how to:

• Power up your garden soil! Discover the secrets of creating fast soil-enriching compost ... the potent compost tea recipe that helps turbocharge plant growth and prevent disease ... and clever mulching secrets to help solve your weeding woes forever.

• Prevent problems from cropping up! Discover the timing and planting secrets for garden success ... how to attract beneficial insects to thwart plant-ruining pests ... and much more.

• Stretch your garden season for MORE veggies! See how to jumpstart your garden by planting seeds inside ... protect early-season plants with simple cover-ups ... and prolong your growing season with smart cold-frame secrets.

• Grow the healthiest, tastiest veggies with these plant-by-plant secrets! For each of 20 common vegetable crops, you'll discover tips for planting, caring for, and harvesting at peak of flavor, plus ingenious secrets of success that help guarantee the best possible results!

Why am I going to send you this book for FREE?

Because I'd like to introduce you to ORGANIC GARDENING, the magazine that has been helping smart gardeners grow great crops without chemicals for almost 70 years!

Try ORGANIC GARDENING for 30 days and cancel if you decide not to continue.
From choosing the best flowers, shrubs, trees, fruits, and veggies to arranging them for spectacular effect, you'll see how to get great results without chemicals!

Plus, you'll get ingenious advice to safely control weeds and pests ... build super-fertile soil ... and grow and prepare a wide variety of vegetables at the peak of flavor.

Don't miss out on this exclusive double-FREE offer to enjoy a healthier, more beautiful garden with the best-tasting veggies you've ever eaten!

Happy Gardening!
Kelly Jennings
for ORGANIC GARDENING
Follow the simple growing secrets in your FREE book, and you'll enjoy the biggest, tastiest garden veggies you've ever grown! For example:
 
SWEETER LETTUCE: These smart tips will help lettuce cope with the heat. Page 44

BIGGER BROCCOLI: Heads can be 2 inches bigger when planted later! Page 32		  
   
  FASTER POTATOES: This simple preseason trick guarantees a quicker harvest! Page 55

FASTER-GROWING MELONS: When they get baseball size, set them on the "throne"! Page 46

PERFECT CORN: Add a few drops of this (see page 31) to prevent earworm damage.

EXCELLENT ONIONS: The secret to success is how you prepare for planting! Page 48		  
 
And that's just a small taste of all the practical help you'll get in your FREE BOOK!

post_title: The Ultimate Guide to Cycling for Beginners
post_text:
Dear Friend,

Back in the old days, riding a bike meant tooling around on a machine with no gears, a basket on the front, and playing cards taped to the spokes for that very cool motorcycle effect. Today, there's a whole new breed of bikes built to suit many different needs. You can choose from road bikes, mountain bikes, touring bikes — to name just a few varieties. So if you haven't taken a spin on two wheels since Santa brought you one for Christmas, it's time to check out The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners to help you find the bike that's perfect.
 
  Cycling is empowering. Pedaling down a rural road or through a city park rouses your spirit and awakens your senses. And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!
Preview The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners free for 21 days. You can return The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners at the end of the preview if you decide not to purchase it.

post_text:
EXCLUSIVE! Not available in stores! Click here
Dear Friend:

If you dream of harvesting huge basketfuls of veggies — free of problems that plague other gardeners — then I have a book with your name on it! But you don't have to buy it ... because you can have it free with your order!
Healthy Soil, Healthy Plants, Healthy Harvest is your one-stop answer book that'll give you predictably wonderful results season after season, year after year! Open up your FREE book and you'll see how to:

• Power up your garden soil! Discover the secrets of creating fast soil-enriching compost ... the potent compost tea recipe that helps turbocharge plant growth and prevent disease ... and clever mulching secrets to help solve your weeding woes forever.

• Prevent problems from cropping up! Discover the timing and planting secrets for garden success ... how to attract beneficial insects to thwart plant-ruining pests ... and much more.

• Stretch your garden season for MORE veggies! See how to jumpstart your garden by planting seeds inside ... protect early-season plants with simple cover-ups ... and prolong your growing season with smart cold-frame secrets.

• Grow the healthiest, tastiest veggies with these plant-by-plant secrets! For each of 20 common vegetable crops, you'll discover tips for planting, caring for, and harvesting at peak of flavor, plus ingenious secrets of success that help guarantee the best possible results!

Why am I going to send you this book for FREE?

Because I'd like to introduce you to ORGANIC GARDENING, the magazine that has been helping smart gardeners grow great crops without chemicals for almost 70 years!

Try ORGANIC GARDENING for 30 days and cancel if you decide not to continue.
From choosing the best flowers, shrubs, trees, fruits, and veggies to arranging them for spectacular effect, you'll see how to get great results without chemicals!

Plus, you'll get ingenious advice to safely control weeds and pests ... build super-fertile soil ... and grow and prepare a wide variety of vegetables at the peak of flavor.

Don't miss out on this exclusive double-FREE offer to enjoy a healthier, more beautiful garden with the best-tasting veggies you've ever eaten!

Happy Gardening!
Kelly Jennings
for ORGANIC GARDENING
Follow the simple growing secrets in your FREE book, and you'll enjoy the biggest, tastiest garden veggies you've ever grown! For example:
 
SWEETER LETTUCE: These smart tips will help lettuce cope with the heat. Page 44

BIGGER BROCCOLI: Heads can be 2 inches bigger when planted later! Page 32		  
   
  FASTER POTATOES: This simple preseason trick guarantees a quicker harvest! Page 55

FASTER-GROWING MELONS: When they get baseball size, set them on the "throne"! Page 46

PERFECT CORN: Add a few drops of this (see page 31) to prevent earworm damage.

EXCELLENT ONIONS: The secret to success is how you prepare for planting! Page 48		  
 
And that's just a small taste of all the practical help you'll get in your FREE BOOK!

And it's hard to hate your thighs as you gleefully pull into the driveway after conquering a challenging ride. As if that weren't enough, cycling is as gentle on your body as an activity can be. There's a saying in sports medicine circles: Even if you can't run, walk, or hobble, you can ride a bike. Because cycling isn't a weight-bearing exercise, it's super easy on your joints — even the achy ones. So it can be a wonderful, pain-free way to get exercise and lose weight. In fact, you can burn about 500 calories on an hour-long ride!

Whether you're looking to ride for fitness or weight loss, to commute or to get away from it all, The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners helps you take your cycling to the next level. You'll find page after page of expert advice designed to help you ride with comfort, speed, safety, and fun. We're so confident you'll like it, we'll let you read it FREE for 21 days!
Did you know you can burn up to 500 calories per hour on your bike? The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners shows you how to eat and ride for maximum weight loss. You'll discover:
 
How to shrink your waist on the road, page 190
The best way to shed pounds and still fuel your rides, page 191
How to maximize your performance with the right carbs-to-protein ratio, page 191
There are common (and less common) things you might want to change on your ride to make it much more enjoyable. They might have to do with the environment you're riding in, for example, in a rainy climate; fenders might allow you to ride much more often. The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners can help you make these tweaks with simple guidelines like:
 
8 critical questions to ask at the bike shop, page 45
Time-tested strategies for finding the perfect saddle, page 72
7 comfort-driven upgrades, page 87
You've got your bicycle, you've got the gear, so you're ready to roll, right? Well ... maybe. To be safe and have fun on the bike, you'll need to know these key tips found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners.
 
4 quick checks before heading out, chapter 22
Repair a flat in minutes! Pro wrench advice, page 240
When to brave the weather, when to pack it in, page 132
Did you know that you might want to change your riding position depending on whether you're on flats, climbing a hill, or descending? Master these positions, along with some easy-to-remember skills and secrets found in The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners, and you can feel relaxed and confident in any situation!
 
Get started like a pro, no wobbling, no weaving, page 107
How to navigate railroad tracks, wet leaves, and other hazards, page 136
5 basic hand signals for group-ride safety, page 154

You'll learn how to lose weight, build muscle, and boost your confidence with the help of The Big Book of Cycling for Beginners! Try it FREE for 21 days!

post_title: Friend - Claim your FREE 96-Page Garden Book!
post_text:
EXCLUSIVE! Not available in stores! Click here
Dear Friend:

If you dream of harvesting huge basketfuls of veggies — free of problems that plague other gardeners — then I have a book with your name on it! But you don't have to buy it ... because you can have it free with your order!
Healthy Soil, Healthy Plants, Healthy Harvest is your one-stop answer book that'll give you predictably wonderful results season after season, year after year! Open up your FREE book and you'll see how to:

• Power up your garden soil! Discover the secrets of creating fast soil-enriching compost ... the potent compost tea recipe that helps turbocharge plant growth and prevent disease ... and clever mulching secrets to help solve your weeding woes forever.

• Prevent problems from cropping up! Discover the timing and planting secrets for garden success ... how to attract beneficial insects to thwart plant-ruining pests ... and much more.

• Stretch your garden season for MORE veggies! See how to jumpstart your garden by planting seeds inside ... protect early-season plants with simple cover-ups ... and prolong your growing season with smart cold-frame secrets.

• Grow the healthiest, tastiest veggies with these plant-by-plant secrets! For each of 20 common vegetable crops, you'll discover tips for planting, caring for, and harvesting at peak of flavor, plus ingenious secrets of success that help guarantee the best possible results!

Why am I going to send you this book for FREE?

Because I'd like to introduce you to ORGANIC GARDENING, the magazine that has been helping smart gardeners grow great crops without chemicals for almost 70 years!

Try ORGANIC GARDENING for 30 days and cancel if you decide not to continue.
From choosing the best flowers, shrubs, trees, fruits, and veggies to arranging them for spectacular effect, you'll see how to get great results without chemicals!

Plus, you'll get ingenious advice to safely control weeds and pests ... build super-fertile soil ... and grow and prepare a wide variety of vegetables at the peak of flavor.

Don't miss out on this exclusive double-FREE offer to enjoy a healthier, more beautiful garden with the best-tasting veggies you've ever eaten!

Happy Gardening!
Kelly Jennings
for ORGANIC GARDENING
Follow the simple growing secrets in your FREE book, and you'll enjoy the biggest, tastiest garden veggies you've ever grown! For example:
 
SWEETER LETTUCE: These smart tips will help lettuce cope with the heat. Page 44

BIGGER BROCCOLI: Heads can be 2 inches bigger when planted later! Page 32		  
   
  FASTER POTATOES: This simple preseason trick guarantees a quicker harvest! Page 55

FASTER-GROWING MELONS: When they get baseball size, set them on the "throne"! Page 46

PERFECT CORN: Add a few drops of this (see page 31) to prevent earworm damage.

EXCELLENT ONIONS: The secret to success is how you prepare for planting! Page 48		  
 
And that's just a small taste of all the practical help you'll get in your FREE BOOK!

post_text:
It sounds crazy, but you can transform any
part of your body in just 10 minutes a day. That’s right: A sexier butt. Leaner legs. Hotter arms. And yes, tighter, toned abs! All in less time than it takes you to shower.

How? With 10-Minute Torchers — the all-new DVD program from the creators of the world-famous Spartacus Workout. Hit play and you’ll discover 12 incredible fat-torching routines that target every part of your body.

Every workout combines the calorie-blasting power of intense intervals with the body-shaping benefits of resistance training. The result: a pulse-pounding sweat session that’ll rev your metabolism, sculpt your body, and help you torch fat faster than ever. All you have to do is choose from the easy-to-use menu of 10-minute routines.

Want to look great in a tank top? Try the Upper Body Blast.
Tired of that muffin top? It’s time for the Belly-Fat Broiler.
Love yoga but want a better calorie burn? Choose Fat-Frying Flow, which combines yoga moves with interval training!
Need to get bikini ready? Go on the attack with Arms and Abs Assault, Lower Body Crush, or Fat Loss Freestyle.

With 12 workouts in all, you’ll never get bored! Have more time? Do two routines for double the burn. You can easily mix and match any of the 10-Minute Torchers to create a workout that’s perfect for YOU! Plus, the only equipment you’ll need is your body and just one pair of dumbbells — nothing more!

post_title: The Four Season Farm Gardener's Cookbook
post_text:
EXCLUSIVE OFFER! Not Available Anywhere Else! 
Dear Friend,

Now it's easy to turn baskets of homegrown veggies into mouthwatering meals, season after season!

The Four Season Farm Gardener's Cookbook is all about living the dream of grow-it-yourself meals and peak-of-freshness flavor, right from your own backyard.
The Four Season Farm Gardener's Cookbook is like a gardening bible and cookbook in one. Not only will it show you how to prepare your garden to produce rich, flavorful harvests, but you'll also find garden-fresh recipes that tantalize the taste buds and satisfy the soul.

You'll discover…

12 practical PEPPER tips, including the easy seed removal technique on page 180. Try it in 12 recipes!

How to grow and prepare over 75 crops, from artichokes to winter squash, blueberries to spinach, and everything in between!

15 expert CARROT tips, including the wiggle harvesting technique on page 154. Try it in 16 recipes!

13 beyond-the-basics BROCCOLI tips, including what to do if tiny yellow buds form (all is not lost!), on page 131. Try it in 8 recipes!

120 mouthwatering recipes that bring seasonal harvests to your plate, 365 days per year!

And much more!
The Four Season Farm Gardener's Cookbook makes garden-fresh recipes right from your backyard a snap to enjoy!

A comprehensive encyclopedia of 75 garden crops, with complete details on how to grow, harvest, and prepare each one

120 savory-and-satisfying recipes to take advantage of garden harvests, season after season, year after year
